page.title: 04CHEDZOY SCHOOL
page.content: CHEDZOY SCHOOL AND SCOOLHOUSE ARE VICTORIAN BUILDINGS WHICH DATE FROM 1875.THE SCHOOL-HOUSE BECAME PART OF THE SCHOOL BUILDINGS IN 1983 AND CONTAINS A KITCHEN FOR COOKERY LESSONS TWO PRACTICAL CLASS-ROOMS,THE HEAD'S OFFICE,STAFF-ROOM ,TOILET AND STORAGE SPACE.THE MAIN CLASS-ROOM IN THE OLD SCHOOL-ROOM IS USED BY THE HEAD- MISTRESS FOR TEACHING THE YOUNGER CLASS OF 8-9 YR OLD PUPILS.THE UPPER CLASS OF 10-11 YR OLD PUPILS ARE TAUGHT IN A HUTTED CLASS-ROOM ACROSS THE PLAY-GROUND BY THE ASSISTANT MISTRESS.THERE IS ALSO A LIBRARY AND COMPUTER AND REPROGRAPHICS ROOM IN THE FORMER INFANT CLASS-ROOM.ALL THE INFANTS NOW GO TO BAWDRIP INFANTS SCHOOL A SECOND ASSISTANT TEACHER COMES ON TWO MORNINGS WEEKLY;THERE IS A CLEANER AND ALSO TWO DINNER-LADIES.
